alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 2:53AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TODAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills approaching 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central and panhandle Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST /11 AM MST/ today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon CST /11 AM MST/ today to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
